intro: Rhodocodon calcicola var. graciliscapus, commonly known as the slender-tailed rock rose, is a rare and specialized plant adapted to grow in calcareous soils. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. The plant's leaves are often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in its arid habitat. It is native to specific regions in the Mediterranean and is considered endangered due to habitat destruction. This variant is distinguished by its slender, elongated stems and is of interest to botanists studying plant adaptation to extreme environments.
